title: Lacroixla61
author: Lacroixla61
content: Hola,I have a diamond 4 account for sale.Account has many crazy perks if you’re a regular player.If anyone is interested, drop a message here and I’ll give you a way to contact me.Edward is my host.Account is close to another massive bonus aswell. (Level up)Wife told me to quit after losing 8 million on this account.Extra perks are 33% cashback on losses.Great reloads.Top player bonus.Etc

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: I wouldn't recommend anyone buy this account. 1 it is against stakes ToS to buy and sell an account, but the person could also take someone's money and claim he was hacked. Just level your own account up and not have the worry guys.

comments.author: Lacroixla61
comments.body: Quote from: Cowboys48 on November 11, 2022, 03:22:12 AMhi, you should delete the thread before someone reports it to stake, there are not many accounts that fit those criteria, and it will be easy to find.you got telegram or such? PM it me please what kind of price are you expecting?Don’t worry mate, not the first account I’ve sold. I am not dumb. I have mixed up all of the details so that my account is not standing out.Tried to PM you, doesn’t work.My TG is @KindSoul111(Also using a different telegram)We can discuss price and I can prove everything, I’m here to get some money for my account rather than it just get closed for nothing. I wasted a lot of time and money building it up and the perks are amazing if a consistent player purchases it.

comments.author: Lacroixla61
comments.body: Quote from: yahoo62278 on November 11, 2022, 03:44:47 AMI wouldn't recommend anyone buy this account. 1 it is against stakes ToS to buy and sell an account, but the person could also take someone's money and claim he was hacked. Just level your own account up and not have the worry guys.Umm, yeah, you’re wrong.You can change the email very easily, I have sold many accounts that the buyers are still using today.

comments.author: Bitinity
comments.body: Quote from: Lacroixla61 on November 11, 2022, 05:00:15 AMQuote from: yahoo62278 on November 11, 2022, 03:44:47 AMI wouldn't recommend anyone buy this account. 1 it is against stakes ToS to buy and sell an account, but the person could also take someone's money and claim he was hacked. Just level your own account up and not have the worry guys.Umm, yeah, you’re wrong.You can change the email very easily, I have sold many accounts that the buyers are still using today.He is telling the truth that account sales against the terms of Stake. Even if there is a way to change the email (which I cant find it), the risk of losing money is on the buyer side. It is even worst when you say that you have sold many accounts, means that you have breached other terms of stake related to multi accounts. It will make the risk for buyer bigger.

comments.author: Kakmakr
comments.body: Just take note of this guys.... There was a major breach of the Stake.com email service and the hacker used Stake's email server to send out a mass phishing attempt to almost everyone that signed up for Stake.com This happened just a few days ago ....and if you look at the Chat sessions... loads of people fell for this phishing scam. A friend of mine clicked on the link and he almost lost his account.... luckily he picked up that it was a scam, so he quickly notified Support and they changed his login details and he got it back. A lot of "hacked" accounts might go up for Sale now, so just be careful. Most of these accounts are linked to verified users... so if they provide their documents, they might get their accounts back ...and you will be locked out of the account, if you bought it. I am not saying this is one of those accounts, but just take caution ...if you are considering buying this account. It might be a legit account, but it is still against Stake's ToS to buy and sell accounts.

comments.author: Docnaster
comments.body: Quote from: Kakmakr on November 11, 2022, 06:32:52 AMJust take note of this guys.... There was a major breach of the Stake.com email service and the hacker used Stake's email server to send out a mass phishing attempt to almost everyone that signed up for Stake.com This happened just a few days ago ....and if you look at the Chat sessions... loads of people fell for this phishing scam. A friend of mine clicked on the link and he almost lost his account.... luckily he picked up that it was a scam, so he quickly notified Support and they changed his login details and he got it back. A lot of "hacked" accounts might go up for Sale now, so just be careful. Most of these accounts are linked to verified users... so if they provide their documents, they might get their accounts back ...and you will be locked out of the account, if you bought it. I am not saying this is one of those accounts, but just take caution ...if you are considering buying this account. It might be a legit account, but it is still against Stake's ToS to buy and sell accounts.  Thank you for this information, you may be saving someone only if they can listen. You are not saying that OP is one of the hacked accounts but there's a near coincidence which anyone should check out for.Another thing is that OP said wife asked him to quit gambling that is why he is selling the accounts. He also said that he has sold such accounts before, which means it's his business not necessarily because of his wife

comments.author: Daltonik
comments.body: Quote from: Kakmakr on November 11, 2022, 06:32:52 AMJust take note of this guys.... There was a major breach of the Stake.com email service and the hacker used Stake's email server to send out a mass phishing attempt to almost everyone that signed up for Stake.com This happened just a few days ago ....and if you look at the Chat sessions... loads of people fell for this phishing scam. A friend of mine clicked on the link and he almost lost his account.... luckily he picked up that it was a scam, so he quickly notified Support and they changed his login details and he got it back. A lot of "hacked" accounts might go up for Sale now, so just be careful. Most of these accounts are linked to verified users... so if they provide their documents, they might get their accounts back ...and you will be locked out of the account, if you bought it. I am not saying this is one of those accounts, but just take caution ...if you are considering buying this account. It might be a legit account, but it is still against Stake's ToS to buy and sell accounts.  Thank you for this warning, I haven't received any letters yet, but it's worth paying attention and being more careful. And regarding the accounts offered for purchase, I would also not recommend someone to purchase them, this may lead to a double loss of your funds from this dubious deal.

comments.author: Slow death
comments.body: the problem with buying an account is that the casino will eventually ask you to do KYC and at that moment they will check what you put in your birth date when you created an account and will compare it with the birth date of the document you are deliveringand after seeing that they are different dates they will close your account, honestly i don't see any advantage in that, of course people never listen so it is more likely that they ignore what i posted and buy account, but at least they are aware that it has high risk of being blocked and losing money that will be in the account and the money they spent buying the account

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: I'd recommend ignoring the OP's offer. if you are interested in buying the account, just know that you are taking a lot of risks if you buy the account. it would be better to just create your own account and fill it out with your own details. Quote from: Kakmakr on November 11, 2022, 06:32:52 AM-snipthis is good info, thanks for sharing! this post certainly makes OP a lot more suspicious and should be avoided.

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Quote from: Lacroixla61 on November 11, 2022, 04:50:42 AMQuote from: Cowboys48 on November 11, 2022, 03:22:12 AMhi, you should delete the thread before someone reports it to stake, there are not many accounts that fit those criteria, and it will be easy to find.you got telegram or such? PM it me please what kind of price are you expecting?-cut-Don’t worry mate, not the first account I’ve sold. I am not dumb.-cut-I don't think anyone said you were dumb, but you are targeting ignorant people and that you most likely are a scammer. And i agree, this is probably not the first time you sold an account, and it was most likely this account you sold before.Also this isn't even correct sections for selling accounts and services. it's here and you should move this thread. Although i wish you would rather delete it.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: Considering Stake is a KYC casino, I am pretty sure the purchase and sale of accounts is forbidden. I would advise to anyone interested not to take OP's offer, just in case. It could result in loss of funds and the purchased account.Quote from: Kakmakr on November 11, 2022, 06:32:52 AM-snip-Man, I had no idea. Thank for this information.I have no idea why, but every time I join a platform, shortly after this one gets their e-mail information leaked and I get a lot of spam, happened to me with Coinmarketcap and now Stake. Fortunately, I have F2A activated just in case I commit the mistake and fall for it.Gotta be my "bad luck"

comments.author: Odusko
comments.body: Stay away from this practice, especially when is written clearly on the Top of the casino that they're against multiple accounts and accounts and that is why KYC verification is sometimes requested, and take example, what if you buy the account and the next day you are asked to provide Verification documents and you are not the original owners.I wish everyone will stay away from this offer and build your account organically and provide KYC when necessary.

comments.author: Eureka_07
comments.body: If it's against the ToS, do not do it. Otherwise, you'll just letting yourself in to trouble as well as your money for a waste.Quote from: Slow death on November 11, 2022, 10:06:45 AM<snip>Is that how the process is? What if the user did not. Put his real birth date upon registration on Stake? Is the birthdate option on Stake is not editable after you created the account? I saw casinos which allows it to be edited and also others which restricts it, I'm just not aware of how it is in Stake in particular.

comments.author: ajiz138
comments.body: This is indeed an illegal practice everyone should refer to the stake.om rules that this is strictly prohibited by them so I wouldn't think that anyone can buy it see other people's advice to avoid it.And those who have been here for a long time won't be affected by the OP's offer but what worries are newbies who just come in and know nothing about the practice which is strictly prohibited.It's clear in Stake.com's terms and conditions of service here:Quote from: https://stake.games/policies/termsPERSONAL USE. The Service is intended solely for the User's personal use. The User is only allowed to wager for his/her personal entertainment. Users may not create multiple accounts for the purpose of collusion, sports betting and/or abuse of service.
